title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: When invoking the New Java Package wizard, a confusing message appears at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists.' However, the package name field is empty at this point. It is unclear what this message means and whether it is an error. It is suggested that if it is an error, the message should be displayed in red with the error icon. There should be no error message when the package name field is empty and the 'finish' button should be disabled.
OB: When invoking the New Java Package wizard and leaving the package name field empty, a message appears at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists.'
EB: When invoking the New Java Package wizard and leaving the package name field empty, there should be no error message displayed. The 'finish' button should be disabled.
SR:
1. Open the IDE.
2. Go to the menu and click on 'File'.
3. From the 'New' submenu, select 'Package'.
4. Leave the package name field empty.
5. Check if a message appears at the top stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists.'
6. Verify that the 'finish' button is disabled.
